content: random rounds is a great stashbusting moss stitch crochet blanket pattern that s designed to work with a mixture of yarn weights and amounts iit s an ideal way to use up leftover yarn and create a diary of your previous projects in blanket form skills used this pattern uses simple stitches throughout including single_crochet and chains to create the moss stitch knowledge of basic crochet stitches techniques and terminology is assumed the pdf pattern includes a printable written pattern a photo guide and a stitch diagram materials you will need around 1000-1100g yarn in a mixture of weights and a 5 5mm crochet hook or size suitable for your chosen yarn to create a similar size blanket the item pictured used 1040g yarn in a mix of fingering 4ply double knit worsted and aran weight in acrylic wool and wool blends finished size the finished blanket pictured measures approximately 140cm / 56in square you can change the size by working a different number of rounds this pattern is not intended for use as a baby blanket in any form the pattern is written in english using standard us crochet terminology the pattern is for personal use only and may not be shared or reproduced without prior written consent copyright dora does limited registered in england no 13992263
